org.sbrubbles.conditio

Interface Handler

  • All Superinterfaces:
    BiFunction<Condition,Scope,Object>, Predicate<Condition>

    public interface Handler
extends Predicate<Condition>, BiFunction<Condition,Scope,Object>
    Handles conditions, producing the result to be returned by signal. It may compute this result by itself, or by delegating the work to a restart of its choice.

    A handler doesn't need to handle a condition; it can decline to do so by returning SKIP. The signalling machinery will then search for another handler, bound later in the stack.

    A handler can do two things:

    • check if it can handle a given condition (with test); and
    • given a condition and its scope of origin, return a result (with apply).

    Since a handler works both as a predicate and as a (bi)function, this interface extends both.

    See Also:
    Condition, Restart, Scope

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Object SKIP
      Returned when a handler, for whatever reason, opts to not handle a particular condition.

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from interface java.util.function.Predicate

        and, isEqual, negate, or, test

      • Methods inherited from interface java.util.function.BiFunction

        andThen, apply

    • Field Detail

      • SKIP

        static final Object SKIP
        Returned when a handler, for whatever reason, opts to not handle a particular condition. By returning this, other handlers, bound later in the stack, will have the chance instead.
